text: Corsair International is a French airline based at Orly Airport. They are the second largest airline in France and fly mainly holiday flights. == History == The airline was started in 1981 and has since been bought over by TUI AG, a German tour operator. Now all of Corsair International's aircraft have the uniform TUI colour scheme of a light blue body with white belly and red writing. These colours were put in place when the airline was called Corsairfly. A new scheme using blue and white colours will replace the current one. == Destinations == Corsair International fly to lots of destinations from Paris. They concentrate on flights to the Caribbean and French speaking African countries. == Fleet == *2x Airbus A330-200 *5x Boeing 747-400 Category:Airlines of France Category:1981 establishments in Europe Category:1980s establishments in France
title: Corsairfly
